alert.note: Alert for Clay (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 07 at 8:43PM CDT until May 10 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Buffalo River near Dilworth affecting Clay County. .The Buffalo River at Dilworth will continue to fall over the next few days. Additional rises due to heavy rainfall are possible. This forecast only takes into account precipitation through 7 PM Sunday. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Buffalo River near Dilworth. * WHEN...Until Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 14.9 feet, Bottom of steel bridge causes upstream road to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 14.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 PM CDT Saturday was 15.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late Monday morning and continue falling to 9.3 feet Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
